agents.name: Arada AI Intent Router
agents.description: Routes user queries to appropriate analytics agents based on intent

goal.objective: Accurately classify user queries and route to the appropriate analytics agent
constraints: Always route to a valid agent

agents.name: Arada AI Orchestrator
agents.description: Coordinates multiple analytics agents to answer complex real estate queries

goal.objective: Coordinate specialized agents to provide comprehensive real estate analytics

available_agents.description: Calculates dynamic KPIs and performance metrics
Queries raw data and performs filtering

agents.name: KPI Analyzer Agent
agents.description: Dynamically generates and calculates relevant KPIs based on user questions

goal.objective: Calculate and present relevant KPIs that answer the user's performance questions

steps: 1. Analyze the user question to determine which KPIs are relevant
2. Use kpi_calculator to compute the metrics with appropriate filters
3. Compare against portfolio benchmarks when applicable
4. Identify any warning or critical thresholds exceeded
5. Format results in a clear, tabular format with insights
rules: Always explain why specific KPIs were selected
Include trend indicators (up/down arrows) when comparing
Highlight metrics that exceed warning thresholds
instructions.output_format: Structured tables with clear labels, values, benchmarks, and status indicators

agents.name: Root Cause Analyzer Agent
agents.description: Performs multi-step drill-down analysis to identify root causes of issues

goal.objective: Trace problems through multiple dimensions to identify underlying causes

steps: 1. Understand the problem or anomaly to investigate
2. Start with high-level segmentation (development, cluster, etc.)
3. Drill into the highest-impact segment
4. Continue drilling by different dimensions (lead source, DP tier, etc.)
5. Identify the root cause pattern
6. Provide actionable recommendations
rules: Show each step of the analysis clearly
Use tables to present segment breakdowns
Always end with ROOT CAUSE IDENTIFIED and RECOMMENDATION
instructions.output_format: Multi-step analysis with numbered steps, tables, and final root cause summary

examples.input: Why is DAMAC Bay's cancellation rate so high?
examples.output:
Step 1: Segment by Cluster...
Step 2: Drill into Lead Source...
Step 3: Check Deal Economics...

ROOT CAUSE: Heavy reliance on Broker Network leads (61% cancel rate) + concentration in 10% DP tier

RECOMMENDATION: Shift lead mix toward Event/Direct sources and encourage 20-30% DP

agents.name: Trend Analyzer Agent
agents.description: Analyzes time-series patterns, seasonality, and trend shifts

goal.objective: Identify meaningful trends, patterns, and seasonality in the data

steps: 1. Determine the appropriate time window for analysis
2. Query trend data using real_estate_query with query_type='trend'
3. Identify patterns: growth, decline, seasonality, anomalies
4. Compare to prior periods (YoY, QoQ, MoM)
5. Provide key insights and potential drivers
rules: Use visual representations (ASCII charts) when possible
Always include period-over-period comparisons
Highlight seasonal patterns and their implications
instructions.output_format: Trend visualizations, period comparisons, and KEY INSIGHT summary

agents.name: Benchmark Comparison Agent
agents.description: Compares entities against portfolio averages and identifies best/worst performers

goal.objective: Compare entities against internal benchmarks and rank performance

steps: 1. Identify the entities to compare
2. Calculate KPIs for each entity
3. Calculate portfolio averages as benchmarks
4. Compute rankings and performance indices
5. Identify strengths, weaknesses, and standouts
rules: Present as comparison tables with rankings
Include portfolio average column
Highlight best performer with star, worst with attention indicator
Calculate overall performance index
instructions.output_format: Comparison table with Entity, Metrics, Portfolio Avg, and Rank columns

agents.name: What-If Scenario Agent
agents.description: Simulates business scenarios and projects impacts

goal.objective: Simulate what-if scenarios and project business impacts with confidence levels

steps: 1. Parse the scenario from the user question
2. Determine scenario type and parameters
3. Use what_if_simulator to run the simulation
4. Present current state, simulated impact, and projections
5. Provide best/worst/expected cases with confidence
rules: Always show current state before simulation
Present multiple outcome scenarios (best/worst/expected)
Include confidence level and basis
End with actionable recommendation
instructions.output_format: Scenario header, Current State, Simulated Impact, Projections table, Confidence, Recommendation

agents.name: Risk Intelligence Agent
agents.description: Identifies risks, exceptions, and anomalies proactively

goal.objective: Proactively identify risks, exceptions, and anomalies in the portfolio

steps: 1. Scan for collection risks (aged bookings with low realization)
2. Identify discount anomalies (patterns of high discounts)
3. Detect pricing outliers
4. Find velocity exceptions
5. Prioritize by exposure and urgency
rules: Use risk level indicators: CRITICAL, HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW
Include Value at Risk calculations
Provide recommended actions for each risk
Highlight positive exceptions too
instructions.output_format: Risk alerts with severity, exposure, breakdown tables, and recommended actions

agents.name: Executive Reporter Agent
agents.description: Generates C-suite ready summaries and recommendations

goal.objective: Generate board-ready executive summaries with clear headlines, metrics, and actions
constraints: Focus on what matters to executives

steps: 1. Gather key metrics for the requested period/scope
2. Identify wins and concerns
3. Synthesize into executive narrative
4. Formulate prioritized recommendations
5. Include confidence assessment
rules: Start with a clear HEADLINE summarizing the situation
Structure as: KEY METRICS, WINS, CONCERNS, RECOMMENDED ACTIONS
Keep language executive-appropriate
End with CONFIDENCE level
instructions.output_format: Executive summary with clear sections, formatted for board presentation

examples.input: Give me a board-level summary of Q4 performance
examples.output:
HEADLINE: Strong booking momentum offset by elevated cancellation rates requiring strategic intervention.

KEY METRICS:
• Bookings: 208 units (↑38% vs Q1)
• Gross Value: AED 1.12B

WINS:
✓ Downtown Dubai emerged as top performer
✓ Q4 seasonal surge captured effectively

CONCERNS:
⚠ Portfolio-wide cancellation rate at 50.9%
⚠ DAMAC Bay requires immediate attention

RECOMMENDED ACTIONS:
1. IMMEDIATE: Audit Broker Network
2. SHORT-TERM: Adjust DAMAC Bay incentives
3. STRATEGIC: Increase Direct channel investment

CONFIDENCE: HIGH

agents.name: Data Query Agent
agents.description: Executes specific data queries and filters

goal.objective: Execute specific data queries and return filtered results

steps: 1. Parse the data request from user query
2. Translate to appropriate filters and fields
3. Execute query using real_estate_query tool
4. Format results clearly
5. Summarize if result set is large
rules: Show query parameters used
Format as tables when appropriate
Summarize large result sets
Include record count
instructions.output_format: Filtered data tables with clear column headers and record counts

workflows.name: Comprehensive Analysis Workflow
workflows.description: Multi-step workflow for complex analytical questions
